message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SY

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category as it deals with sampling from a lattice Gaussian distribution, which is a fundamental problem in coding and cryptography. It may also belong to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category as it discusses the importance of lattice Gaussian sampling in cryptography. Additionally, the paper proposes a Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) method, which is a common technique in the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. The paper also presents a sampling algorithm based on Gibbs sampling, which is a popular method in the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the convergence of the proposed algorithms, which is a topic in the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
